member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.WindowsServer.Implementation.AzureMetadataRequestor.AzureImsApiVersion
member.summary: Azure Instance Metadata Service exists on a single non-routable IP on machines configured by the Azure Resource Manager. https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=864683 .

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.WindowsServer.Implementation.AzureMetadataRequestor.AzureImsRequestTimeout
member.summary: Default timeout for the web requests made to obtain Azure IMS data. Internal to expose to tests.

members.member:
Private function for mocking out the actual call to IMS in unit tests. Available to internal only.
parameter sent to the func is a string representing the Uri to request Azure IMS data from. An instance of AzureInstanceComputeMetadata or null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.WindowsServer.Implementation.AzureMetadataRequestor.BaseAimsUri
member.summary: Gets or sets the base URI for the Azure Instance Metadata service. Internal to allow overriding in test.
member.remarks: At this time, this service does not support https. We should monitor their website for more information. https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/virtual-machines/windows/instance-metadata-service .

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.WindowsServer.Implementation.DataContracts.AzureInstanceComputeMetadata
member.summary: Class representing the returned structure from an Azure Instance Metadata request for Compute information.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.WindowsServer.Implementation.DataContracts.AzureInstanceComputeMetadata.VerifyExpectedValue(System.String)
member.summary: Because the Azure IMS is on a non-routable IP we need to do some due diligence in our accepting values returned from it. This method takes the fieldname and value received for that field, and if we can test that value against known limitations of that field we do so here. If the test fails we return the empty string, otherwise we return the string given.
member.param: Name of the field acquired from the call to Azure IMS.
member.returns: The value of the field, verified, or the empty string.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Common.HeadersUtilities
member.summary: Generic functions that can be used to get and set Http headers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Common.HeadersUtilities.GetHeaderKeyValue(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Get the key value from the provided HttpHeader value that is set up as a comma-separated list of key value pairs. Each key value pair is formatted like (key)=(value).
member.param: The header values that may contain key name/value pairs.
The name of the key value to find in the provided header values.
member.returns: The first key value, if it is found. If it is not found, then null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Common.HeadersUtilities.UpdateHeaderWithKeyValue(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Given the provided list of header value strings, return a list of key name/value pairs with the provided keyName and keyValue. If the initial header value strings contains the key name, then the original key value should be replaced with the provided key value. If the initial header value strings don't contain the key name, then the key name/value pair should be added to the list and returned.
member.param: The existing header values that the key/value pair should be added to.
The name of the key to add.
The value of the key to add.
member.returns: The result of setting the provided key name/value pair into the provided headerValues.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Common.HeadersUtilities.SanitizeString(System.String)
member.summary: Http Headers only allow Printable US-ASCII characters. Remove all other characters.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Common.Internal.ExperimentalConstants
member.summary: These values are listed to guard against malicious injections by limiting the max size allowed in an HTTP Response. These max limits are intentionally exaggerated to allow for unexpected responses, while still guarding against unreasonably large responses. Example: While a 32 character response may be expected, 50 characters may be permitted while a 10,000 character response would be unreasonable and malicious.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Common.Internal.ExperimentalConstants.DeferRequestTrackingProperties
member.summary: This is used to defer setting properties on RequestTelemetry until after Sampling. QuickPulse expects these properties so we have to set them here as well. Used to set QuickPulseTelemetryProcessor.EvaluateDisabledTrackingProperties and RequestTrackingTelemetryModule.DisableTrackingProperties.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Common.Internal.InjectionGuardConstants
member.summary: These values are listed to guard against malicious injections by limiting the max size allowed in an HTTP Response. These max limits are intentionally exaggerated to allow for unexpected responses, while still guarding against unreasonably large responses. Example: While a 32 character response may be expected, 50 characters may be permitted while a 10,000 character response would be unreasonable and malicious.

member.summary: Max length of incoming Request Header value allowed.

member.summary: Max length of context header key.

member.summary: Generates random trace Id as per W3C Distributed tracing specification. https://github.com/w3c/distributed-tracing/blob/master/trace_context/HTTP_HEADER_FORMAT.md#trace-id .

member.returns: Random 8 bytes array encoded as hex string.

member.summary: Formats trace Id and span Id into valid Request-Id: |trace.span.

Span id.

member.summary: Reads Correlation-Context and populates it on Activity.Baggage following https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/blob/master/src/System.Diagnostics.DiagnosticSource/src/HttpCorrelationProtocol.md#correlation-context.
